result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Rene Navarro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.  Credit listed below is not duplicate to 15CF578.
Consecutive to: to 15CF578

STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Consecutive to: to 15CF578

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with Samantha Weiss.  No contact with victims.  If undergoing any type of medical procedure, defendant is to inform physicians that he has had an opiate issue.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance w/Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI as well as the letter provided today by Ms. Lang Muffitt. Deft is stipulating to restitution. No additions or corrections noted by parties. 15cf578-6 yrs bifurated as 3/3, 15CF1624-4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2/2, consec and in 15CF11-consec probation.

         15CF11-On both counts, total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - STAYED. 3 yrs probation, consec to time being served. If probation is revoked, the time will be consec.

Attorney Kathleen Renee Lang in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
The Court has received a ZCI report regarding defendant's current status. Defendant was given furlough to attend to some medical issues but deft has cut off his GPS bracelet and has left the residence. Ms. Lang Muffitt spoke to the deft's mother who indicated that the information is correct.  The State asks for BW/BF

Ct 1: 943.201(2)(a)-MIsapprop ID info/Obtain Money; Ct 2: 961.41(1m)(b)-Poss w/intent-Deliver Non-Narcotics; Ct 3: 961.41(1m)(i)-Poss w/intent-Schedule IV Drugs; Ct 4: 961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place; Ct 5: 943.34(1)(a)-Receiving/Concealing Stolen Prop; Ct 6: 961.573(1)-PDP. DEFENDANT POSTED $1000.00 ON 01-12-2015 AND THEREFORE MUST POST AN ADDITIONAL $5,000.00. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim DW & SW, CW, GL (person, property, residence or family).    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 07-02-2015; DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED FURLOUGH FOR MEDICAL TESTING/APPOINTMENTS. DEFENSE WILL PROVIDE THE STATE PROOF OF EACH APPOINTMENT.

AMENDED 08/19/2015 - DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED TO ATTEND PRE-OP APPOINTMENT ON AUGUST 20, 2015 AT 2:00 PM AND HE SHALL BE RETURNED TO RACINE COUNTY JAIL AFTER SURGERY AND RECOVERY ON OCTOBER 26, 2015 NO LATER THAN 5:00 PM. WHILE RELEASED, DEFENDANT SHALL BE ON GPS/HOUSE ARREST WITH EXCEPTIONS ONLY FOR DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, SURGERY, THERAPY APPOINTMENTS, ATTORNEY APPOINTMENTS, AND COURT.
